availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Bullitt (Lawrence County, Indiana, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Lawrence County, Indiana, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William N. Bullitt and Virginia H. Bullitt. Educated at Oberlin College in Oberlin, Ohio. Farmer in Lawrence County, Indiana in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as adjutant, first lieutenant, maor, and lieutenant colonel from September 9, 1862 to October 13, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Lawrence County, Flinn, p. 612.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 594.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 171.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #58,948, Certificate #38,723.
"Colonel Bullitt Dead,"Mitchell Tribune(Mitchell, Indiana), September 27, 1917, p. 1.
Find A Grave, "William A. Bullitt (1840-1917)," Memorial #37898602, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/37898602 (accessed August 6, 2020).
